Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.enhancement

Class RefreshHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.enhancement.RefreshHandler
  • public class RefreshHandler
extends java.lang.Object

    A RefreshHandler can be added to a Tree using a TreeDecorator. You can use the handler to define the refresh behavior by e.g. setting a message or calling the refresh done. Clients will use native refresh facilities e.g. pull down.

    Since:
    1.4
    See Also:
    TreeDecorator

        public RefreshHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage​(java.lang.String message)

        Sets the message the client should show during a refresh.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to show. Must not be null.

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()

      • addRefreshListener

        public void addRefreshListener​(RefreshListener listener)

        Adds a RefreshListener that will be notified when the user has triggered a refresh. After the refresh is done you need to call done() to hide the refresh UI on the client.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add. Must not be null.

      • removeRefreshListener

        public void removeRefreshListener​(RefreshListener listener)

        Removes a RefreshListener.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove. Must not be null.

      • getRefreshListeners

        public java.util.List<RefreshListener> getRefreshListeners()

        Returns the added RefreshListeners

      • done

        public void done()

        Instructs a client to hide it's refresh UI. Usually this method will be called within a RefreshListener.refresh() method after the refreshing is done.
